body.p: The DITA Open Toolkit project file allows you to define all your DITA Map input and filter pairs and to produce the desired output formats by applying the publishing engine over this single project file: .

has special support for creating, editing, validating and publishing DITA Open Toolkit Project files represented in XML format. It can also use such files to detect connections between DITA resources in the entire project and to apply root map and filter pairs when editing.

topic.title: Editing DITA Open Toolkit Project Files

body.p: The File->New wizard dialog allows you to create DITA Open Toolkit project XML files. A sample project file can be found in the application samples folder OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR/samples/dita/mobile-phone/mobilePhoneProjectFile.xml.
Content completion is done according to the associated schema and it is enhanced with proposals for ID references and available transformation types.
The validation support has enhanced Schematron rules which report invalid references to non existing contexts.

When working with a DITA OT Project file in the Author visual editing mode you can see by default a compact representation of the file. The Styles drop down combo box allows you to switch to the Edit style which gives you tools to edit the file using form controls and inline buttons. The additional View as YAML style allows you to see a visual representation of the same document in YAML.

topic.title: Publishing DITA Open Toolkit Project Files

body.p:
Once a DITA OT project XML file is opened in the application, the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) button allows you to access two predefined publishing scenarios:
Publish DITA-OT Project (all deliverables) - Run the publishing engine and produce output for all deliverables defined in the project file.
Publish DITA-OT Project (select deliverable) - Run the publishing engine and produce output for only one deliverable specified by the end user.

topic.title: Master Files Support for DITA Open Toolkit Project Files

body.p: If you enable master files support at project level you can choose to detect all top level DITA Open Toolkit project XML files and to add them to the master files folder. You can also add manually in the application project master files folder the top level DITA OT Project Files for your project. Once you do this, all renames or moves of DITA topics, maps, filter files and project files performed in the Project view will properly update all references to those resources.

topic.title: Editing Contexts Detected from DITA Open Toolkit Project Files

body.p: Once the DITA OT Project XML files are added to the Project master files folder, in the DITA Maps Manager view the Context combo box will start containing context DITA Map and filter pairs gathered from the project file. When such a context is selected in the combo box, the application will gather the keys from the context DITA Map and apply the filters specified in the context.
